comments:
Build ID: M20070212-1330

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Open the Open Repository Task dialog (Ctrl-Shift-F12)
2. Enter the key of a Jira issue to load and check to add the issue to a Task List Category
3. To confirm that the handle is incorrect, open the tasklist.xml file in an xml editor - the JiraIssue xml node for this task has attribute Handle of the form "http://<repository>/jira-<key>" when tasks loaded from the repository using other methods (e.g. queries) have a handle of the form "http://<repository>/jira-<id>"
4. Once this task is closed, it can not be synchronized/opened because mylar tries to refresh using the invalid handle.

More information:
I am running with version 2.0.0.v20070514-1800 of Mylar Connector: JIRA, Focused UI, and Task List, and version 0.9.3 of Jira Core Services.

I first noticed this bug because the Task cannot be opened from the Task List once it has been closed, I assume because the handle is used to refresh the task from the repository before opening the task.  I can still open other Tasks created via Jira queries.  Sample event details (from the error log) from trying to open a task with an invalid handle follow:

eclipse.buildId=M20070212-1330
java.version=1.6.0_01
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86

Error
Mon Jun 11 12:57:08 PDT 2007
No repository found for task. Please create repository in Task Repositories view.
I have also seen this occasionally when creating new tasks through the rich editor.
Eugene, could you take a look at this bug?
Will try to do that over the week end.
I haven't been able to reproduce this with the latest CVS head. Eugene, if you want to verify this, you need to apply the patch posted to bug 149624.

JIRA editor now failing for me with the error below when I try to open tasks using "Open Repository Task" (Ctrl-Shift-F12) or from hyperlinks in History view with Subclipse. Same task opened ok from results in the Search view.

I can't figure out why it happens now, but could be a result of recent refactorings around editor. TasksUiUtil.openEditor() call used to handle taskKey just fine and been delegating to connector for retrieving task data.

Created an attachment (id=72294)
fixed open repo task job to use task id from task data

Rob, Mik, please apply. That fixes opening remote JIRA tasks
*** Bug 194105 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
